context: The word 'jääd' is the 2nd person singular present tense form of the verb 'jääma', which means 'to remain' or 'to stay'. It's used when talking to one person (you) about an action that is happening now or generally. In Estonian, this form can also be used in commands or suggestions. The root word 'jää-' relates to staying in place or not moving from a location.
